page.title: 13Technology on Papa Stour.
page.content: Most of the changes in the last few years have been in agriculture.The first modern tractor came to the island in 1960 (a two wheeled tractor had previously replaced the temperamental Icelandic ponies used for ploughing in 1952).Now a bailer, rotavators,ploughs etc are in common use. We don't have mains electricity here so most people have their own diesel generators.The school's is the largest with 5 kw.Generators are only run in the evening usually for a few hours because it's not economic to run a generator for a small load.Therefore freezers and fridges can present difficulties.A small wind generator (producing 12 volts) has run success fully for many years.A bigger wind generator failed,the brakes wore out and the blades fell off within months.
